channel.title: Return To Base - DJ Paul Simmons
channel.description: From the belly of the Paul Simmons Archives.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Podcasts of all genres from Northern Soul, Funk, Rare Grooves, House, and much more...
channel.itunes:author: Paul Simmons
channel.itunes:summary: From the belly of the Paul Simmons Archives.

item.title: INdifference - Deep House Podcast
item.description: Hi Everyone, and welcome to the latest edition of the Return To Base Podcast, This months Christmas special INdifference is a deep house collection, with more than enough groove and bass-line to warm you up in this rather nasty winter season. The Name simply signifies our INdifference as human beings, no barriers of colour, race, religious beliefs or sexual preference here, we all have ears.... Digitally mixed for your enjoyment. See you again in the new year with a special Classic House Podcast (1986-1990) I know some of my friends eagerly await that 1, not long now guys......Px
item.dc:creator: Paul Simmons
item.itunes:summary:

item.title: To My Brother - Clint Lee Walters 27-08-79 – 04-04-10
item.description: To My Brother Hello again, and welcome to my latest podcast, this cast is rather special, earlier this year I lost a very close friend he was like a brother to me, and help to shape the man I am as well as the DJ I’ve become, taking me to my first gay club in London some 10 years ago, being as well connected as Clint was within the scene at that time it was not long before I was able to pass my demo on to the guys at Salvation-London, the rest as we say is history, the music featured on this podcast is from a period when myself and Clint did quite a lot of clubbing together, and also represents my explosion on to the scene, it’s dedicated to one of the best friends I’ve ever known and will never forget. I love you brother.....I know your Bumping to these Tracks......... Clint Lee Walters 27-08-79 – 04-04-10
item.dc:creator: Paul Simmons
item.itunes:summary:
To My Brother
Hello again, and welcome to my latest podcast, this cast is rather special, earlier this year I lost a very close friend he was like a brother to me, and help to shape the man I am as well as the DJ I’ve become, taking me to my first gay club in London some 10 years ago, being as well connected as Clint was within the scene at that time it was not long before I was able to pass my demo on to the guys at Salvation-London, the rest as we say is history, the music featured on this podcast is from a period when myself and Clint did quite a lot of clubbing together, and also represents my explosion on to the scene, it’s dedicated to one of the best friends I’ve ever known and will never forget. I love you brother.....I know your Bumping to these Tracks.........
Clint Lee Walters 27-08-79 – 04-04-10

item.title: Reggae – Vol 1 (Revival Selection)
item.description: Hello again, and welcome to the Monthly podcast, This month we come to Reggae – Vol 1 (Revival Selection) This podcast is not about rarities these records are widely available on many different compilations, although these tracks on this Podcast are taken from the original vinyl's, at this point I must ask you to excuse some of the recordings as they are rather crackly, however I wanted to record it to share with you some of what I grew up listening to, those deep memories of the black eyed peas socking on the stove whilst my mother would be putting a load of washing in the machine for the week ahead, and these would be the tracks my father would be playing in the background creating the perfect soundtrack to black family life at home on a Sunday after we’d come back from church, I’ll say no more other than....Enjoy....OH and I do apologize for our missing guest this session DJ DEXTROUS. He promises that he will be joining us for Reggae vol 2.

He promises that he will be joining us for Reggae vol 2.

item.title: Northern Soul/Soul/Funk - Vol 2
item.description: Hello again, and welcome to my monthly podcast, we bring to you this month the much anticipated NORTHERN SOUL/SOUL/FUNK – VOL2, after the surprising success of Volume 1 I can tell you that I very much enjoyed compiling this Volume, Introducing for the first time in the series the GODFATHER OF SOUL... Mr James Brown and ending the Chapter with some Turkish Funk from Mr Mustafa Ozkent. I have tried to delve a little deeper to give you even more pieces that are almost impossible to find on vinyl or download on the internet. Sit back and let the music set the scene and take you right back to the late 60’s early 70’s, when even the way people spoke was made up of Soul/Funk (Jive)..... I’ll be bringing you NS.S.F - VOL 3 in July. Watch out for next month’s podcast – REGGAE VOL 1 ft. Special Guest DJ DEXTROUS....It’s going to be awesome don’t miss it....Enjoy...xx

item.title: I’M STAYING IN TONIGHT/ANYONE WANNA BUMP? - DJ Paul Simmons (BONUS PODCAST)
item.description: Hello everyone, and welcome to the bonus editions, these podcasts are extra podcasts that I will be uploading alongside the main monthly podcasts, just a little extra music to tickle the taste buds. This first bonus edition is entitled I’M STAYING IN TONIGHT/ANYONE WANNA BUMP? And is mainly for those deep house heads who still want that bump but are too attached to Facebook and Twitter to actually venture far from the computer. There is no real order to the grooves in this podcast, the records are simply compiled from the way we were feeling on the night, the tracks do have 1 thing in common with each other THE BUMP, there is no order to the year of the tracks chosen either, but all are from within the last decade, put it on the iPod or simply enjoy at home either way your body will want to move to these grooves.....enjoy
item.dc:creator: Paul Simmons

item.title: Northern Soul/Soul/ Funk Vol. 1
item.description: From the belly of the Paul Simmons Archives, some of the rarest Soul & Funk music on the planet. All tracks compiled from the original LPs & 7" Vinyl’s (please excuse the crackles) a compilation of this magnitude would cost a small fortune, as a DJ and an avid record collector I have for many years been asked to put together CD’s for friends, now I feel it’s time to share with a wider audience. I do hope that you enjoy this first volume of Northern Soul/Soul/Funk there will be more volumes to accompany this series and I will also be adding Classic House/Techno/Balearic and Rare Jazz/Jazz Funk including some of the funkiest Film Soundtracks known to man, I do hope you will Enjoy my collection over this coming year as much as I have enjoyed collecting them over the last 30 years.... I’ll be uploading a post EVERY month, for a year..... With special guests and bonus podcasts to keep your taste buds lubricated!
